"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54e6ee2a63687236764c0c00#post_54e6ee2a63687236764c0c00
The difference here is, most parents will react much more poorly to it's deaths then the ones in Naruto, so it's not as likely to be watched by as many young children, remember the reason Naruto and Dragon Ball have such insanely large fandoms is the way they grew over time, the early parts hook in the little kids and they mature so they don't drop the series as they grow,

"@Ore-O":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54e733036368721495320700#post_54e733036368721495320700
The story of how the last piece of bread in the world is now under the possession of a man who needs the bread to eat with his soup. But then, people started attacking him, wanting to steal his bread.

But he says no!

He needs the bread! Who can enjoy soup without bread?!
